definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: I took out my wallet and nervously fumbled for the pictures of my family.
sentences.chinese: 我拿出了皮夾，慌手慌腳地翻出了我的全家福照片。

sentences.english: Yeah, 150 members of Gao in De Chang county took the photo.
sentences.chinese: 是的，德昌縣高家150多人拍成了“百人全家福”。

sentences.english: He sent me a letter together with a photograph of his family.
sentences.chinese: 他寄給我一封信裏面附了一張他的全家福照片。

sentences.english: Liu Hong is showing the class an old photo of her family.
sentences.chinese: 劉虹正在給全班看一張她家以前的全家福。

sentences.english: Four sun kang to find a Zhang Shang every family, in the clothes inside pocket.
sentences.chinese: 孫四康找到一張湯伯凡的全家福，放進衣服內兜。

sentences.english: A:Is this a photo of your family?
The pictures were taken at a Ren family reunion at Shishe village in China's eastern province of Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 拍攝這張全家福的成員是浙江省石舍村的任家。

sentences.english: This is the photo of my childhood.
sentences.chinese: 本正在看蘇海的全家福照片。

sentences.english: He said yes, and the “Family Portrait Project” was born.
sentences.chinese: 他回答是，“全家福項目”就此誕生。

sentences.english: A: Here’s a picture of my family.
sentences.chinese: 這是一張我們家的全家福。

sentences.english: I wanna take a family portrait.
You can buy framed photos of the new first family.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以買到相框裝幀好的奧巴馬一家的全家福。

sentences.english: Putting your family's picture in the house, and name the style of your family members.
sentences.chinese: 把全家福照貼於房子內，並標出每個家庭成員的稱謂。

sentences.english: Many of our families might not otherwise have a family portrait.
sentences.chinese: 否則，許多家庭可能沒有一張全家福。

sentences.english: The rugby stripe version might be just the thing for this year's holiday photo.
sentences.chinese: 橄欖球條紋版正好可以穿着拍聖誕全家福。

sentences.english: The son toke out a camera for a photo of whole family gladly.
sentences.chinese: 兒子高興地拿出相機，準備照張全家福。

definition: to take a joint photo/group photo
head-and-shoulders photo (esp. a formal one used in a passport, ID card etc)
a person's face as seen from the front
to appear on camera/to play a role in a film
to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
